alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 2:17PM PST until January 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 7000 feet. Storm total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet above 7000 feet, except up to 5 feet above 8000 feet. Winds gusting to 50 mph, except 100 mph or more along ridgetops. Wave heights of 3 to 6 feet on Lake Tahoe. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Strong winds and high waves may capsize small vessels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow totals of 1 to 5 inches below 6500 feet (including Lake Tahoe) will be possible, mainly Saturday night into early Sunday as snow levels drop. Snow levels may vary during the storm, with a rain/snow mix possible just below the snow levels. Watch for freezing on roadways.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water, clothing and tire chains. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time. Avoid boating on Lake Tahoe until conditions improve.If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
